title: Principle Extractor

placeholders.name: text
placeholders.label: Paste the source content (article, transcript, notes)

template: Extract clear, generalizable principles from {{text}} and show practical application.
- Role: distill enduring principles from messy narrative content.
Assumption: Prefer imperative, testable phrasing over platitudes.
- Each principle must include applicability, limits, and one example.
- Avoid jargon; 1–2 sentence rule per principle.
1. Identify candidates — repeated patterns, causal links, decision rules.
2. Normalize — convert to imperative, testable statements.
3. Boundaries — note applicability contexts and failure modes.
4. Application — provide one concrete example per principle.
- Principles: list of objects {title, rule, applicability, failure_modes, example}.
- Each has applicability and at least one failure mode.
Revise once if any Quality Check would fail.
